Detailed Description

The Data Buffer class holds a chunk of memory to read and write to. Data Buffers will automatically resize when written to when needed.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Default constructor

DataBuffer::DataBuffer ( char *  data,
size_t  size 
)

Constructor with data intialization This copies the data passed in and sets the position to 0

void DataBuffer::resize ( size_t  newSize  ) 

Resizes the data buffer to a given size. if the newSize is smaller than the previous size the buffer position is set back to the begining

Parameters:
newSize the new size for the buffer
void DataBuffer::rewind (  ) 

Sets the current data pointer to the begining of the buffer

void DataBuffer::seek ( size_t  bytes  ) 

moves the position in the buffer forward by an amount seek will no go past the end of a buffer or before the begining

Parameters:
bytes the amount to move forward in the buffer
void DataBuffer::setSize ( size_t  size  ) 

Sets the size of the data buffer currently in use

Parameters:
size the new size
